what: imuGAP: an Estimation Model for Measles Vaccination Coverage
title: imuGAP: an Estimation Model for Measles Vaccination Coverage
text:
name imuGAP stands “Immunity: Geographic & Age-based Projection”, name implies, package provides stan-based model estimating measles vaccination coverage location age cohort. core model represents target population life-long propensity vaccination; proportion, ϕ\phi, population unlikely vaccinate complementary proportion, 1−ϕ1 - \phi, likely vaccinate. population experiences vaccination rate, λ\lambda, model time eras, according vaccination eligibility schedule, ν
u. core parameters can vary time location, user-specifiable way. Focusing just core model element, imagine particular population location ii cohort aa (aa denotes start time period group born). cohort now age tt, vaccine schedule first dose ν(t)
u(t), expected fraction group least one dose : P(≥1 dose)=(1−ϕi,)(1−exp{−∫atλi,(s)ν(s)ds}) P(\ge	extrm{1 dose}) = \left(1 - \phi_{, }ight) \left(1 - \exp\left\{-\int_a^{t} \lambda_{, }(s)
u(s) d	extrm{s}ight\}ight) say, representing vaccination coverage via survival model. Leaving aside “unlikely” population

title: Estimate Measles Vaccine Coverage
text: imuGAP provides fitting imputation / prediction tool particular process model vaccination uptake. tool provides flexible trends relationships elements process. Briefly, process model consists two parts: lifetime tendency towards vaccination time varying force vaccination. effects occur nested setting - largest enclosing population, mutually exclusive internal populations lowest resolution level.

title: Check location data — check_locations

title: Check location data — check_locations
text: locations data.frame, integer columns id parent_id. See Details restrictions.

title: Check location data — check_locations
text: data.table, canonical location structure, layer column

title: Check location data — check_locations
text: imuGAP() works hierarchical model locations, needs told structure . method checks location structure valid, returns canonical version including layer size. id may duplicates. row id == 1, must parent_id == NA. max(id) must equal number rows, give take presence root id == 1 - put another way, id must seq_len(dim(locations)[1]) (, give take 1 root node). ordering, id parent_id must (diff(id) == 1) (diff(parent_id) %% c(0, 1)). Intended future capability: able extract location structure satisfies requirements. particular: allow root 1; defined parent_id == NA accept arbitrary column types id, including non-covering set integers, parent_id; return object include appropriate remapping applied weighting data accept arbitrary layer depths

title: Validate obs_population object for imuGAP — check_obs_population
code: check_obs_population(   obs_population,   observations,   locations,   max_cohort,   max_age )  check_obs_population(   obs_population,   observations,   locations,   max_cohort,   max_age )

title: Validate obs_population object for imuGAP — check_obs_population
text: obs_population data.frame, observation weighting object, columns obs_id, observation id row concerns dose, dose row concerns location, location row concerns cohort, cohort location row concerns age, age cohort row concerns weight, relative contribution row observation Note multiple rows may concern observation, meaning populations different cohorts, locations, ages may pooled observation observations data.frame : nonnegative integer positive column positive integer sample_n column, must greater equal positive column optionally, id column, 1:size(observations) locations data.frame, integer columns id parent_id. See Details restrictions. max_cohort present, maximum cohort present? max_age present, maximum age present? max_obs_id optional positive integer, maximum valid observation id max_location optional positive integer, maximum valid location id subset logical; FALSE (default), observations must complete. TRUE, max_obs_id must provided.

title: Validate obs_population object for imuGAP — check_obs_population
text: x valid, returns canonical obs_population object

title: Validate obs_population object for imuGAP — check_obs_population
text: valid obs_population object must: convertible data.table via data.table::setDT() contain columns "obs_id", "location", "cohort", "age", "dose", "weight" obs_id, integers >= 1; max_obs_id provided, <= max_obs_id; subset FALSE, integers 1:max_obs_id must present location must positive integer less equal max_location. however, locations need represented wts cohort must positive integer age must positive integer dose must 1 2 weight must positive numeric value; weights must sum 1 obs_id

text: x valid, raises error describing issue.

title: Immunity: Geographic & Age-based Projection, imuGAP — imuGAP
text: observations data.frame, observed data, least two columns: column named "positive", first column; non-negative integer, observed number vaccinated individuals column named "sample_n", second column: positive integer, number individuals sampled exists column "id", must unique, used primary key observation data; otherwise, unique id created based row number obs_populations data.frame providing meta-data observations. Briefly, capture observation relevant location(s), cohort(s), age(s), dose, relative contribution population observation. row obs one corresponding rows wts. wts data.frame least following columns: column named "obs_id", value "id" column obs "location", positive integer, distinguishing locations. "cohort", positive integer, distinguishing cohorts "age", positive integer, distinguishing observation applies location/cohort "dose", positive integer, dose observation applies "weight", positive numeric value, representing relative contribution population observation locations location hierarchy, data.frame two columns: "id", positive integer, location id "parent_id", positive integer NA, parent location id; root location NA parent_id dose_schedule numeric vector length 2, ages dose 1 dose 2 scheduled imugap_opts options imuGAP model stan_opts passed rstan::sampling (e.g. iter, chains).
